segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho nandiyaṃ sakkaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Seated to one side, the Buddha said to Nandiya the Sakyan:

segments.pli: “catūhi kho, nandiya, dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo.
segments.en: “Nandiya, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.

segments.pli: Idha, nandiya, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.
ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
segments.en: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, nandiya, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato ariyasāvako sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti.
segments.en: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”

suttaplex.blurb: A noble disciple with the four factors of stream-entry is a stream-enterer.
